summary: This is an email chain from March 2021 discussing a judge's ruling on redactions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondents note that the details deemed 'sensational and impure' by the judge are actually sentences from the indictment against Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal case and the redaction ruling being discussed in the email chain.

persons.name: AJN
persons.context: Referred to in the email as someone who may not have realized certain details were part of the indictment and wanted them redacted.

events.title: Judge Rules on Redactions in Maxwell Case
events.description: A judge ruled that certain details in a Ghislaine Maxwell court filing are 'too sensational and impure' to be revealed to the public.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated March 18-19, 2021, discussing a legal development in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
A judge ruled that specific details in a Maxwell court filing were 'too sensational and impure' for public release.
The email correspondents indicate that the redacted 'sensational and impure' details are sentences from the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email suggests someone (AJN) may have requested redactions without realizing the details were already part of the public indictment.
